fr.sii.ogham.testing.assertion.sms

Class FluentSmsAssert<P,S extends SubmitSm>

  • java.lang.Object
    • fr.sii.ogham.testing.util.HasParent<P>
      • fr.sii.ogham.testing.assertion.sms.FluentSmsAssert<P,S>
  • Type Parameters:
    P - the parent type
    S - the type of the SubmitSm

    public class FluentSmsAssert<P,S extends SubmitSm>
extends HasParent<P>
    Make assertions on particular message.

    • Method Detail

      • content

        public FluentSmsAssert<P,S> content(org.hamcrest.Matcher<? super String> matcher)
        Make assertions on the content of the message(s). Alphabet/encoding is automatically determined from message (based on Data Coding Scheme). 
         .receivedMessages().message(0)
    .content(allOf(notNullValue(), is("hello world"))
        Or: 
         .receivedMessages().message(0)
    .content(notNullValue())
    .content(is("hello world"))
        Will check if the content of the first message is not null and is exactly "hello world". 
         .receivedMessages().every()
    .content(allOf(notNullValue(), is("hello world"))
        Or: 
         .receivedMessages().every()
    .content(notNullValue())
    .content(is("hello world"))
        Will check if the content of every message is not null and is exactly "hello world".
        Parameters:
        matcher - the assertion to apply on message content
        Returns:
        the fluent API for chaining assertions on received message(s)

      • content

        public FluentSmsAssert<P,S> content(Charset charset,
                                    org.hamcrest.Matcher<? super String> matcher)
        Make assertions on the content of the message(s). Alphabet/encoding used to decode the message is explicitly provided. 
         .receivedMessages().message(0)
    .content(allOf(notNullValue(), is("hello world"))
        Or: 
         .receivedMessages().message(0)
    .content(notNullValue())
    .content(is("hello world"))
        Will check if the content of the first message is not null and is exactly "hello world". 
         .receivedMessages().every()
    .content(allOf(notNullValue(), is("hello world"))
        Or: 
         .receivedMessages().every()
    .content(notNullValue())
    .content(is("hello world"))
        Will check if the content of every message is not null and is exactly "hello world".
        Parameters:
        charset - the charset to use to decode the message (bytes to string)
        matcher - the assertion to apply on message content
        Returns:
        the fluent API for chaining assertions on received message(s)

      • rawRequest

        public FluentPduRequestAssert<FluentSmsAssert<P,S>,S> rawRequest()
        Make assertions on the raw request (SubmitSm) of the message(s) using fluent API. 
         .receivedMessages().message(0).rawRequest()
   .alphabet(is(Alphabet.ALPHA_DEFAULT))
   .shortMessage()
     .header(array(equalTo(0x01), equalTo(0x02), equalTo(0x03))))
     .payload(arrayWithSize(10))
        Will check if the received byte array of the first message has a header with some expected bytes, the alphabet used to encode the message is ALPHA_DEFAULT and the payload has exactly 10 bytes. 
         .receivedMessages().every().rawRequest()
   .alphabet(is(Alphabet.ALPHA_DEFAULT))
   .shortMessage()
     .header(array(equalTo(0x01), equalTo(0x02), equalTo(0x03))))
     .payload(arrayWithSize(10))
        Will check if the received byte array of every message has a header with some expected bytes, the alphabet used to encode the message is ALPHA_DEFAULT and the payload has exactly 10 bytes.
        Returns:
        the fluent API for chaining assertions on received message(s)

      • from

        public FluentSmsAssert<P,S> from(org.hamcrest.Matcher<PhoneNumberInfo> matcher)
        Make assertions on the sender of the message(s) using fluent API. 
         .receivedMessages().message(0)
    .from(notNullValue())
        Will check if the sender phone number of the first message is not null. 
         .receivedMessages().every()
    .from(notNullValue())
        Will check if the sender phone number of every message is not null.
        Parameters:
        matcher - the assertion to apply on the phone number
        Returns:
        the fluent API for chaining assertions on received message(s)

      • from

        public FluentPhoneNumberAssert<FluentSmsAssert<P,S>> from()
        Make assertions on the sender of the message(s) using fluent API. 
         .receivedMessages().message(0).from()
    .number(is("+33102030405"))
    .typeOfNumber(is(TypeOfNumber.INTERNATIONAL))
        Will check if the sender phone number of the first message is exactly "+33102030405" and sender phone number type of the first message is an international number. 
         .receivedMessages().every().from()
    .number(is("+33102030405"))
    .typeOfNumber(is(TypeOfNumber.INTERNATIONAL))
        Will check if the sender phone number of every message is exactly "+33102030405" and sender phone number type of every message is an international number.
        Returns:
        the fluent API for chaining assertions on received message(s)

      • to

         .receivedMessages().message(0)
    .to(notNullValue())
        Will check if the recipient phone number of the first message is not null. 
         .receivedMessages().every()
    .to(notNullValue())
        Will check if the recipient phone number of every message is not null.
        Parameters:
        matcher - the assertion to apply on the phone number
        Returns:
        the fluent API for chaining assertions on received message(s)

    .number(is("+33102030405"))
